attributes.action: protect Winchester, England's ancient capital and one of the UK's cultural treasures, from being completely obliterated by mis-conceived, large-scale development proposals.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Winchester is under imminent threat of massive development.
    Winchester City Council (WCC) has declared Barton Farm as its
    “Preferred Options” site for 2,000 houses in its Local
    Development Framework document. Barton Farm is a green wedge of
    land on the northern outskirts of Winchester and is integral to
    Winchester’s unique landscape setting. Ignored by their elected
    representatives, the people of Winchester have formed the “Save
    Barton Farm Group” (SBFG) which has rapidly grown into the
    largest community group in Winchester with 5,000 supporters and
    growing.The full Council meets to make its final decision on
    22nd April 2009 – time is therefore of the essence.  The
    Council claim Barton Farm is the “least damaging” option for
    Winchester. SBFG say that is not good enough – Winchester
    deserves the best option not the “least damaging”. We propose a
    long-term plan for Winchester to take full advantage of the
    things that make Winchester special – its history, culture,
    arts and unrivalled landscape setting.  Please sign this
    Petition and visit our website at www.savebartonfarm.org for
    further information. Thank you

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "protect Winchester, England's ancient capital and one of the UK's cultural treasures, from being completely obliterated by mis-conceived, large-scale development proposals."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22658


Prime Minister's Office
